Description: Lower body and foot sherd of Corinthian, possibly black-glazed, pottery kotyle; interior: glazed black; exterior: three narrow rays rising from narrow band; band on outer and inner face of foot; underside: traces of one narrow band; most of black is lost, only traces (fired brown) remaining, leaving the surface pale buff.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.244) (phase 3)
